## 1. Suggested changes

**Why?** To save you and your collaborators a few steps! 

![](images/suggested-changes.png){width=50%}

::: aside
[Link to documentation](https://docs.github.com/en/pull-requests/collaborating-with-pull-requests/reviewing-changes-in-pull-requests/incorporating-feedback-in-your-pull-request#applying-suggested-changes)
:::


## 2. Draft pull requests

**Why?** To encourage early (and work-in-progress) feedback! 

![](images/draft-pr.png){width=40%}

::: aside
[Link to documentation](https://docs.github.com/en/pull-requests/collaborating-with-pull-requests/proposing-changes-to-your-work-with-pull-requests/about-pull-requests#draft-pull-requests )
:::


## 3. Wiki pages

**Why?** Because not everything needs to go in your README! 

![](images/wikis.png){width=45%}

::: aside
[Link to documentation](https://docs.github.com/en/communities/documenting-your-project-with-wikis/about-wikis)
:::


## 4. Issue and pull request templates

**Why?** Because reducing cognitive load is helpful! 

![](images/pr-template.png){width=60%}

::: aside
[Link to documentation](https://docs.github.com/en/communities/using-templates-to-encourage-useful-issues-and-pull-requests/about-issue-and-pull-request-templates)
:::

**Why?** Because colors! (and organization)

![](images/labels.png){width=45%}

::: aside
[Link to documentation](https://docs.github.com/en/issues/using-labels-and-milestones-to-track-work/managing-labels)

**Why?** Because snapshots help regularly updated projects! 

![](images/releases.png){width=45%}
